kiss kiss bang bang
see it when it comes out.
Stuart is an eagle scout. And we all went out to cheer him on. And I am fiddling with Photoshop cause everyone is in school during the day. fishstick...

Whew, Another scramble is complete. The newly renamed "Team Soppy Suit?" comleted our three and half minute opus entitled Brax to the Max and we eagerly anticipate this friday when we will be screened (unless we are disqualified). These weekends are intense! We created a really dark movie this time because we were assigned the genre NOIR so you can look forward to a moody dark piece starring Jake Bridges with Stuart Webb playing the role of the Drug Dealing brother. I cannot wait to see how it goes over on friday. I hope everyone likes this Sitcom as much as we do =)

I dont know many LJ people and lots of people already did this

Everyone that helped out on the Sidewalk Spot.  It is officially airing now.  It premeired last night on Fox6 news and will be periodically playing throughout the summer.  Not that i encourage watching the news nonstop but who knows, some of you may see yourselves on TV!  Thanx again for those that helped.
-daniel

01. Comment with your name and I will write something about you.
02. I will then tell what song/movie reminds me of you.
03. I will try to name a single word that best describes you.
04. I'll tell you the most memorable moment I've had with you.
05. I will tell you what animal you remind me of.
06. I'll then tell you something that I've always wondered about you.
07. I'll write something you've taught me.
08. Put this in your journal. [unless you already have]. 

i've never done one of these...will it be fun?

sincerest thanks to everyone that showed up for the commercial shoot! It went great and i'll post when it is up and running on Fox6 (which we hope will be soon). Special thanks are dure to Lewis Leahy for bringing in so many people, Erin Johnson for form distribution services and to everyone that turned in their release. Anyone who didnt we need them soon. here is a preview:

NEWS
-We are filming a scene for a commercial on Thursday at noon and need as many cooperative teenage extras as possible,
-It will air on Fox6 throughout the summer in a 30, 20, and 10 second format,
-We are shooting at Acton Park on Acton Road
-You will have to sign a release form and will have to get a parent signature if you are under 18
-You should dress casually like normal without any obvious advertisements on your clothes like (OLD NAVY!!!) We can't get the rights for such stuff and could be sued. :)
-You will be needed for a couple of hours only if everyone is patient and efficient and cooperative,
-You will need to run a lot so wear tennis shoes
-It will be fun and you might see yourself on TV!!!!
If you need a form or have a question email me: hasafgagen@gmail.com

Hey everyone (or you two people) that reads this!
Next wendsday I (Daniel Scheinert) am shooting a commercial for the Sidewalk Filmmaking Competition with Ryan Marlowe and we want as many teenagers (grades 7 thorugh 12 and that includes graduating seniors and anyone that looks like they are that old) to show up for the shoot.  Copy and past this to your live journal please.  It will be at Acton Park on Acton Road (the townhomes) and it will be fun.  The spot will air on Fox6 all throughout teh summer so be there.
I will give you definite times, links about the location and additional info soon
-daniel
I have a hard time communicating how hard it is to communicate.

Hey the Soppy Suit DVD is ready for sales if you guy a copy feel free to give us your email and we will keep you posted on screenings of our movies and other news. I like you

If anyone isnt excited about Soppy Suit Shorts vol II then here is why you should be: -all four films of 2004 -behind the scenes commentaries -an in depth behind the scenes look into the making of soppy suit films, featuring interviews with sources such as these two:

Allo there buddies, Soppy Suit will be presenting yet another film this Saturday!!! "Black Blocks, White Cirles" will be a part of the 2004 november sidewalk scramble screening and you should be there! Stuart and Zach (soppysuit and heyitszach) cowrote and directed this one and it is sure to be an interesting one. The evening will feature around 20 other films as well as presentations of winners blah blah blah you should come. It's a musical about the alabama law forbidding playing dominoes on sundays created by those of us who do not do musicals! woopie! Be sure to check out stuart zach daniel white and jonathan wade in this newest installment to the soppy suit repertoire. in the mean time this should keep ya happy my favorite comic ever! Saw it in black and white.

It's official. Soppy Suit Productions will have at least two films screening at the 2004 Sidewalk Film Festival, with one pending until selected as a finalist or scrapped into the abyss of failure. This year's the festival will feature the World Premiere of A B l a c k T i e A f f a i r Starring: Zach Rucker & Stuart Webb Directed by: Daniel Scheinert Best Man and Best Boy: Jake Bridges and Rusty Butler As well as an encore screening of the February Sidewalk Scramble winner of Judges Choice "Best Comedy" Pavement Casserole Starring: Dylan Hunter, Zach Rucker, Stuart Webb, Jake Bridges & Lobster Ensemble: Brett D in the House, Keith, Jonathan Wade, Andrew Schwartz, and a bunch of other people whose names allude me but will reply to this post if they really want their names listed. Music By: The Holy 5-tet (Dylan, Me, Stuart, Jake and Zach) Also the Festival will hopefully entail the Premiere of My Little Princess IX: best friends fornever which will be competing in the High School Filmmaking competition. until next time adieu

A New Movie Coming Out
Starring as Usual the ever-talented Stuart Webb
& Zach Rucker
(As you can surely tell, this one is full of all sorts of dramatic faces and oscar worthy performances) For a little change of pace, you can expect to see some blood, tense violence, and special effects in this one folks.
After three weeks of planning, a week of pre-production and storyboarding, a week of shooting consisting of around 22 hours of on set filming, and a week of editing and soundmixing together a Orchestrated soundtrack we finally have a whopping five minute movie! I would like to go ahead and thank the Lovely Erin Johnson, the Obese Jake Bridges, and the Laughing Grace Collins for all their help on the shoots. You can hopefully expect this one late this coming september if we are selected as a Sidewalk High School Filmmaking finalist. oh yeah and in my life school started...I read the wrong book for summer reading, and forgot about our 80 pages of workbook work due for french. yaaaay!!!

Have you seen this spoon weilding man? -If so you have already been blessed by the brilliance of Don Hertzfeldt (he made that short film) -If you have not seen this banana then you are missing out on one of the most life changing experiences of your life, it is quite possibly one of the funniest films ever created. Anyway that film (Rejected) and many like it are coming June 8th to workplay as a part of the Sidewalk Cinematheque! If you have seen the film and liked it then copy and paste this or create a post on your livejournal and let the masses know that the Animation Show is finally coming to town. The animation show is a collection of animations put together by legendary animators Don Hertzfeldt (rejected, billy's balloon, genre) and Mike Judge (Beavis and Butthead, King of the Hill). It features Billy's Balloon, and Rejected by Don H. as well as three new shorts, created by Don just for the Animation Show, that you cannot see anywhere else. It also has films from all over of all varieties (from CG, and claymation to black and white, and painted). After years of touring the show is finally coming to Birmingham and it will be worth your time. check out the website for the screening and please make a point to come to the show. www.theanimationshow.com www.sidewalkfilm.org ps I am a consumer whore!

Ok folks so I finally figured out how to do what I originally wanted to do with LJ's. Post Pictures!!!! I will be giving you teasers of the upcoming soppy suit films and anything else i deem fit. Just to give this picture thing a try i will introduce you to my pretty and a scary picture Stu and I took. my pretty! my EMO-afied pretty haha the scream!!! hope you enjoyed them and keep lookin for further tidbits of genius.

OY! As you know I am the director editor etc. of the upcoming Soppy Suit Film A Black Tie Affair starring the wonderfully talented Zach Rucker and Stuart Webb. This film is currently being completely re-edited on my computer due to a massive computer failure but in the mean time we have some still's to show you of the upcoming short film. I will be giving you these teasers just a few at a time over the next week or so. A Black Tie Affair the rooftop shot (potential logo?) the leads Stuart & Zach keep posted for the next teasers. Also check out some of the original shoot pictures on soppysuit 's lj
A Black Tie Affair some more Zach and Stu stills from the battle
A BLACK TIE AFFAIR leads photo shoot cont... hurt zach curious stu

The Sidewalk Scramble is complete!!! special thanks to all the cheering and mmmming extras. The film is entitled Pavement Casserole and will be screened at 7 at the carver theatre on Friday. visit the sidewalk website for additional information. Here is a little preview Seth's dramatic Entrance in >Pavement Casserole

We are currently back into full on editing of A Black Tie Affair which will be submitted to sidewalk. Things are going well on the Soppy Suit Productions front. I even get to help screen the feature films for the festival to help determine which films should be taken to the second round of screening woohoo! However on the me front i miss Erin like crazy cuz it is spring break and she is gone and I am here. I have been able to hang out with stu which is cool but zach is gone as well along with jake and so i am editing my movies haha. At least as much as i can since my computer has starting failing for the third time in the past month or so. Anyway as usual here are a few more screen shots (sorry for the grainy quality im working on that and i am open to suggestions. i am currently using photobucket) super awesome one handed cartwheel by the ever talented stuart webb face off in our huge parking deck
I want everyone who reads this to ask me 3 questions, no more no less. Ask me anything you want. Then, I want you to go to your journal, copy and paste this allowing your friends to ask you anything.

How happy is the blameless vestal's lot! The world forgetting, by the world forgot. Eternal sunshine of the spotless mind! Each pray'r accepted, and each wish resign'd -if you have not seen it, it is imperitave that you rectify the situation forthwith!

The upcoming Soppy Suit masterpiece as previewed on soppysuit's lj is now tentatively called A Black Tie Affair and is in the process of being edited. after which it will be mailed off to a conveniently placed cousin to be scored and then polished. woohooo!!!!
